title: Semesa Rokoduguni
text:
<a href="Lance%20corporal">Lance corporal</a> Semesa Rokoduguni (born 28 August 1987) is a Fijian-born English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player currently playing for English club <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a>, and soldier in the <a href="British%20Army">British Army</a>, having <a href="War%20in%20Afghanistan%20%282001%E2%80%93present%29">served in Afghanistan</a>.
Club career.
Lytchett Minster RFC.
Roko joined LMRFC in Feb 2008 while training with the army at Bovington camp.
Roko played for just over a season playing in the centre where he scored many tries and helped the club gain promotion to Hampshire 1
Army RU.
Rokoduguni has represented the <a href="Army%20Rugby%20Union">Army Rugby Union</a> XV, and German <a href="Rugby-Bundesliga">Rugby-Bundesliga</a> team <a href="DRC%20Hannover">DRC Hannover</a>. He represented the army twice in the 2011-2012 season, scoring four tries against the RAF and three against the <a href="Army%20Navy%20Match">Navy</a>.
He has also represented the Army Sevens team in the <a href="Middlesex%20Sevens">Middlesex Sevens</a> and the International Defence Sevens, the latter of which was won by the Army.
Bath Rugby.
In October 2012, it was announced that Rokoduguni had been signed on a senior contract with <a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a> after impressing for their second side, Bath United.
Rokoduguni made his debut for the Bath senior team on 10 November 2012, in their <a href="Anglo-Welsh%20Cup">LV= Cup</a> match against <a href="Dragons%20%28rugby%20union%29">Newport Gwent Dragons</a>. He scored a try after just 9 minutes, and finished the game with two tries.
International career.
In January 2014, he was included in a 25-member <a href="England%20Saxons">England Saxons</a> squad to prepare for the upcoming match against the <a href="Irish%20Wolfhounds">Irish Wolfhounds</a>.<ref name="https://www.theguardian.com"></ref>
On 8 November 2014, Rokoduguni made his Test debut for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a>, losing to <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">New Zealand</a> 21-24 as part of the <a href="2014%20end-of-year%20rugby%20union%20internationals">2014 Autumn Internationals</a>. He was the first serving British soldier to play for England since <a href="Tim%20Rodber">Tim Rodber</a> in 1999.
In 2015 Rokoduguni was called up into the England Rugby World Cup Squad, after <a href="David%20Strettle">David Strettle</a> completed his move to French-based side Clermont.
Personal life.
Rokoduguni is a sniper of the <a href="Royal%20Scots%20Dragoon%20Guards">Royal Scots Dragoon Guards</a> in the British Army. He joined the Army in 2007 and was deployed to Afghanistan as part of <a href="Operation%20Herrick">Operation Herrick</a> in 2011 where he was attached to <a href="Highlanders%20%28Seaforth%2C%20Gordons%20and%20Camerons%29">4th Battalion, The Royal Regiment of Scotland</a> (4SCOTS).
His great-great-grandfather, great-grandfather and father all served in the military.
